@oobe-protocol-labs/synapse-client-sdk
  • @oobe-protocol-labs/synapse-client-sdk
  • SynapseClient

Class SynapseClient

Name

SynapseClient

Description

The core client for interacting with the Synapse RPC Gateway. This class handles all low-level communication with the gateway, including request serialization, response deserialization, and error handling.

Author

SteveTheHead

Author

0xArmorer

sequentialBatch

  • sequentialBatch<T>(input, options?): Promise<SequentialBatchResult<T>>

  • Sequential Batch - Intelligent pair-based batching with auto-chaining

    Revolutionary batching system where method outputs automatically feed into subsequent method inputs using JSON path extraction and array expansion.

    TIER-BASED PRICING MODEL:

    • Base Cost: 1 quota per pair (fixed)
    • Expansion Cost: count × tier_efficiency
      • Free: 0.80 quota/expansion (19% savings)
      • Starter: 0.70 quota/expansion (29% savings)
      • Professional: 0.60 quota/expansion (38% savings)
      • Enterprise: 0.40 quota/expansion (58% savings!)

    Example Pricing (24 transaction expansions):

    • Free: 1 + (24 × 0.80) = 20.21 quota
    • Starter: 1 + (24 × 0.70) = 17.80 quota
    • Professional: 1 + (24 × 0.60) = 15.40 quota
    • Enterprise: 1 + (24 × 0.40) = 10.60 quota

    Auto-Chaining Features:

    • inputFrom: Source request index (0 for previous request)
    • inputPath: JSON path to extract value (e.g., '[].signature')
    • expandArray: Expand array to N parallel calls
    • targetParam: Parameter index to inject extracted value (default: 0)

    Type Parameters

    • T = any

      Type of individual results (default: any)

    Parameters

    • input: SequentialBatchInput

      Single pair or array of pairs to process (fully typed)

    • options: SequentialBatchOptions = {}

      Request options with sequential batch configuration

    Returns Promise<SequentialBatchResult<T>>

    Promise with type-safe results, tier-based pricing metadata, and execution stats

    Example

    Single Pair with Expansion (Free tier: 20.21 quota for 24 tx):
    const result = await client.sequentialBatch([
      { 
        method: 'getSignaturesForAddress', 
        params: [address, { limit: 10 }] 
      },
      { 
        method: 'getTransaction', 
        inputFrom: 0, 
        inputPath: '[].signature', 
        expandArray: true,
        params: [null, { encoding: 'jsonParsed', maxSupportedTransactionVersion: 0 }]
      }
    ]);
    // Gets signatures, extracts them, then automatically fetches all transactions
    // Cost: 1 base + (N × 0.80) quota where N = number of signatures

    Example

    Multiple Pairs (2 base quota + expansion costs):
    const result = await client.sequentialBatch([
      [
        { method: 'getSignaturesForAddress', params: [address1, { limit: 5 }] },
        { method: 'getTransaction', inputFrom: 0, inputPath: '[].signature', expandArray: true }
      ],
      [
        { method: 'getTokenAccountsByOwner', params: [owner, { mint }] },
        { method: 'getAccountInfo', inputFrom: 0, inputPath: 'value[].pubkey', expandArray: true }
      ]
    ]);
    // Two independent pairs: 2 base quota + (pair1_expansions × tier) + (pair2_expansions × tier)

    Example

    Custom Parameter Injection:
    const result = await client.sequentialBatch([
      { method: 'getBlock', params: [12345] },
      { 
        method: 'getTransaction', 
        inputFrom: 0, 
        inputPath: 'transactions[0].transaction.signatures[0]',
        params: [null, { encoding: 'json', commitment: 'confirmed' }]
      }
    ]);
    // Extracts first signature from block and fetches its transaction details

    See

    • Sequential Batch Documentation
    • Tier-Based Pricing Guide
    • SequentialBatchResult for complete result type definition
    • SequentialBatchMetadata for pricing metadata details

    Since

    3.0.0

    • Defined in packages/synapse-client-sdk/src/client.ts:315
